title: Tormey E Reimer
text:
Wow, you found my website!


Unfortunately, there’s nothing here. You’re either very lucky, very bored, or a cheeky miscreant. You should check back later…

title: Blog
text:
As we learn and experiment, we end up doing a lot of work that doesn’t actually make it into any final product. I often think about the time that went into that work, and I wonder if anyone else has ever tried to solve the same problem before or since. How many times have we quietly reinvented the wheel?
This is my random collection of musings, templates, code snippets, and other bits and pieces that I’ve created over the years but don’t have anywhere to publish.


Laying out figures with ggplot2


Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.3.2



p1 = ggplot(data = iris, 
            aes(x = Sepal.Length, 
                y = Petal.Length, 
                color = as.factor(Species))) +
    geom_point() +
    theme_classic()

Code and links (H2)


Code and link appearance inline: ggplot() and geom_point() require package ggplot2, which is available from CRAN.


library(ggplot2)
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, colour = as.factor(Species))) +
    geom_point() +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(legend.position = "none")









Lists (H3



Is this an ordered list?
Who knows, honestly
I think so!



Different paragraphs (H4)


This text is in a “body” div.

This text is not. Any difference?

This text is in a “p” div.


Would I even use this (H5)


I’m also pretty sure that I can change the background/visuals of blocks quite easily. Not sure I’d want to do this much (as the callouts are pretty much the same thing) but it’s cool to know.
